meta.dc:subject: legislation
meta.dc:rights: the Government of the Hong Kong Special Administrative Region

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation
section.leadIn: In this Regulation, unless the context otherwise requires—
section.def: competent person (勝任人士), in relation to any duty to examine a gasholder under this Regulation, means a person who is competent to perform the duty by virtue of his practical and theoretical training and actual experience;
dry-sealed gasholder (乾封式儲氣鼓) means a gasholder other than a water-sealed gasholder;
water-sealed gasholder (水封式儲氣鼓) means a gasholder in which water is used to prevent gas escaping to the atmosphere between the lifts of the gasholder.

subsection.leadIn: The owner of a gasholder shall cause it to be examined externally by a competent person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: before it is first put into use; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: after it is put into use, at least once in every month.

subsection.content: The owner of a dry-sealed gasholder shall submit a report in the form set out in Schedule 1 once every 3 months.
An examination under subsection (1)(a) shall be carried out in the presence of the Authority.
An examination under subsection (1), and any work carried out in connection therewith, shall be done in an efficient and workmanlike manner.

When, on an examination under this section, any defect in a gasholder is discovered, the owner thereof shall, as soon as practicable, cause a report in writing to be delivered to the Authority which shall contain a full description of the defect and of any work carried out in connection therewith.
Where such defect materially affects the safety of the gasholder the report shall be delivered to the Authority within 24 hours after the discovery of the defect.

The owner of a gasholder shall cause full and up to date records to be kept of all examinations and works carried out under this section and shall make such records available for inspection by the Authority.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Annual examination of gasholders
section.leadIn: The owner of a gasholder shall—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: cause to be carried out, in the presence of the Authority, an external examination of the gasholder not less than once every year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: within 4 weeks after such examination, submit to the Authority a report thereon—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: in the case of a water-sealed gasholder, in the form set out in Schedule 2;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: in the case of a dry-sealed gasholder, in the form set out in Schedule 3;

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: in any other case, in the approved form.

subsection.content: Subject to section 5, the owner of a gasholder shall, as soon as is practicable after the expiration of 20 years from the date of construction of the gasholder, and thereafter once in every period of 10 years, cause it to be thoroughly examined internally in order to ascertain the condition of its internal structure and of its surfaces and sealing arrangements.
Every examination under subsection (1) shall be carried out by a competent person in the presence of the Authority.
Within 4 weeks of every examination under subsection (1), the owner shall submit to the Authority a report thereon in the approved form.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Authority may direct the manner of examination

subsection.content: The Authority may permit a water-sealed gasholder to be examined in such a manner as he may direct in lieu of the thorough internal examination specified in section 4.
An examination under subsection (1) shall be carried out by a competent person in the presence of the Authority.
Within 4 weeks of an examination under subsection (1), the owner shall submit to the Authority a report thereon in the approved form.

Whenever a water-sealed gasholder is examined under subsection (1), the owner of the gasholder shall cause a thorough internal examination thereof as specified in section 4 to be carried out as soon as practicable thereafter.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Examination cutting samples
section.content: Where, under section 5(1), the Authority directs that a water-sealed gasholder be examined by cutting samples from the crown and sides of the holder, all samples so cut shall be marked in such a way as to make them readily identifiable and shall be kept available for inspection at any time.

subsection.content: The owner of a gasholder shall be liable for all expenses incurred in any examination, or work carried out as a consequence of such examination, of the gasholder under this Regulation.
Any such expenses shall be recoverable from the owner as a civil debt due to the Government.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Offences
section.content: The owner of a gasholder who contravenes any provisions of section 2, 3, 4 or 5 commits an offence and is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Power to amend Schedules
section.content: The Secretary may, by notice in the Gazette, amend Schedule 1, 2 or 3.

schedule.name: sch1
schedule.text: FormQUARTERLY GASHOLDER INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE RECORDDRY-SEALED GASHOLDER

td.p: Stock in holder at time of inspection:
—signs of folds, creases, surface cracks or drag down:
Variations in level of piston/fender unit taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Variations in clearance between shell and piston/fender taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Variations in clearance between shell and telescoping fender taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Condition of balance weight and rope:
Lubrication of all locks and hinges:

schedule.name: sch2
schedule.text: FormANNUAL GASHOLDER INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE RECORDWATER-SEALED GASHOLDER

td.p: Type of gasholder (i.e. column, spiral or rope guided):
Lifts—Diameter and depth of, and pressure thrown by each lift:
Position and number of gas and air vents:
Position in relation to ground level:
Number of patches on crown sheets.
Condition of ladder or staircase and handrail (including crown handrails).
Number of patches on side sheets.
Condition of cup and deposits and leakage, and effective depth of seal.
State of inflation at the time of inspection.
Condition of ladder or staircase and handrail.
External condition of cup and grip.
Cup deposits and leakage and effective depth of seal.
State of inflation at the time of inspection.
Condition of ladder or staircase and handrail.
External condition of cup and grip.
Cup deposits and leakage and effective depth of seal.
State of inflation at the time of inspection.
Condition of ladder or staircase and handrail.
Condition of bottom carriages and rollers.
Condition of ladder or staircase, handrail and balcony.
Horizontal measurements from lift to lift at:
Vertical measurements from top of grip to water level at:
Positions of rollers relative to guides on each lift.
Repairs and paintwork carried out since last annual inspection:

schedule.name: sch3
schedule.text: FormANNUAL GASHOLDER INSPECTION AND MAINTENANCE RECORDDRY-SEALED GASHOLDER

td.p:
Stock in holder at time of
inspection:
Off-site condition (within a region of 30 m from gasholders)
On-site condition (within a region of 6 m from gasholders or boundary of gasholder premises, whichever is the greater)
Foundation settlement with respect to East, South, West and North
Guard below levelling weight with respect to East, South, West and North
Earthing connections with respect to East, South, West and North
Footing with respect to East, South, West and North
—Wire ropes (10% of 8 times of wire diameter):
Piston plating, framing, fender, walkway and handrail:
Shell belt angle and piston seal bar:
—signs of folds, creases, surface cracks or drag down:
Variation in level of piston/fender unit taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Variations in clearance between shell and piston/fender taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Variations in clearance between shell and telescoping fender taken at each wire rope near top, midway and bottom:
Inlet, outlet and drain pipes and fittings:
Repairs and/or paintwork carried out since last inspection
